summary_of_threads_started_this_week:
In the ongoing effort to enhance Bitcoin's privacy and efficiency, /dev /fd0 introduces Octojoin, a solution that improves transaction privacy by blending multiple inputs, making them appear indistinguishable from regular transactions. This approach, inspired by an octopus's camouflage, is detailed on the [Octojoin official page](https://octojoin.github.io/), inviting community feedback to refine the solution further. Tim Ruffing, Jonas, and Nick are drafting a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) for Distributed Key Generation for FROST Threshold Signatures, aiming to bolster cryptographic practices within the Bitcoin ecosystem. Their work, including a Python reference implementation, is open for community review on [GitHub](https://github.com/BlockstreamResearch/bip-frost-dkg).

Murch reviews several BIPs poised for status updates, focusing on enhancements ranging from security with passphrase-protected private keys to efficiency in transaction processing and network communication protocols. Notable proposals include BIP 38 by Mike Caldwell and Aaron Voisine, and BIP 67 by Thomas Kerin et al., with the community encouraged to review these BIPs listed on [Murch's review](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/85f17817-e7cd-4896-85c6-ed0ed04f9219@murch.one/T/#u#m5134110222c12057275b2e0fe020298e86a800d8). Meanwhile, the release of Bitcoin Core version 26.2 introduces new features and enhancements, detailed on [Bitcoin Core's website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-26.2/), alongside a call for feedback on issues via the project's [GitHub issue tracker](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues).

Ed Hughes proposes a logarithmic-size ring signature scheme, LS-LSAG, aimed at improving blockchain technologies by reducing signature size without compromising security. This proposition, detailed in a draft on [ePrint](https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/921), invites community feedback. Additionally, sipa explores the concept of cluster linearization to optimize Bitcoin Core's transaction processing and block generation through efficient mempool management, with further details available on [Delving into Bitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/introduction-to-cluster-linearization/1032), highlighting continuous efforts to enhance the Bitcoin network's functionality and efficiency.

new_threads_this_week.title: Octojoin: Payjoin with no interaction between sender and recipient
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Bitcoin developers introduce Octojoin to enhance transaction privacy by mimicking octopus camouflage.
- Octojoin allows combining multiple inputs in one transaction, complicating on-chain analysis.
- It also aims to increase swap usage and provides a platform for selling statecoins from coinjoined UTXOs.

new_threads_this_week.title: BIP Draft: "ChillDKG: Distributed Key Generation for FROST"
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Jonas, Nick, and Tim draft a BIP for FROST Threshold Signatures with a Python reference.
- Their work, hosted on GitHub, aims for community feedback on design and implementation.
- Ongoing aspects include finalizing the wire format and preparing for a separate FROST signing BIP.

new_threads_this_week.title: BIP Authors: These BIPs could be Final
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The email reviews Draft or Proposed Bitcoin Improvement Proposals, suggesting updates to Final status.
- It discusses enhancements like passphrase-protected private keys and deterministic multi-signature addresses.
- The sender prompts BIP authors to update their status, reflecting implementation or community acceptance.

new_threads_this_week.title: Bitcoin Core 26.2 released
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 26.2 is now available, featuring new improvements and bug fixes.
- Upgrade guidance includes shutting down prior versions thoroughly before installation across multiple OS.
- Significant updates include script handling adjustments and networking changes for enhanced performance.

new_threads_this_week.title: A new logarithmic-size signature scheme LS-LSAG
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Ed Hughes introduces a novel ring signature scheme LS-LSAG for blockchain technologies.
- LS-LSAG offers significant size efficiency improvements and full-chain compatibility.
- It relies on discrete logarithm for unforgeability, without trusted setup in its design.

new_threads_this_week.title: Introduction to cluster linearization
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- Cluster linearization aims to improve Bitcoin Core efficiency by restructuring the mempool.
- It creates transaction clusters for better transaction relay, block validation, and fee estimation.
- Efforts include developing algorithms for optimal transaction organization and enhancing blockchain scalability.

active_posts_this_week.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Quantum computing may soon decrypt Bitcoin due to advancements like Shor's algorithm and IBM's Heron QPU.
- Quantum attack efficiency heavily depends on the quantum computing system's hardware specifications.
- Potential Bitcoin defenses against quantum attacks include adopting post-quantum cryptographic schemes and introducing a "witness-stack size scale ladder."

active_posts_this_week.title: Public disclosure of 10 vulnerabilities affecting Bitcoin Core < 0.21.0
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Antoine Poinsot is requesting CVE numbers for historical issues from Mitre.
- This approach will catalog vulnerabilities that lacked formal documentation.
- It's a crucial step for enhancing security by accurately tracking known issues.

active_posts_this_week.title: Idea for BIP : Deterministic Wallets with Token support
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Managing a comprehensive list of all tokens for hardware wallets poses significant challenges.
- Extended public keys enhance security but raise privacy concerns in hardware wallet use.
- Employing distinct application codes for each token could improve transaction privacy but has limitations.

active_posts_this_week.title: Is it time to increase the blocksize cap?
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The Bitcoin block size debate includes technical, economic, and philosophical elements.
- Concerns about centralization and network efficiency highlight the complexity of increasing block size.
- A balanced approach, considering various impacts and innovations, is crucial for Bitcoin's evolution.

active_posts_this_week.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The Fiat channels proposal offers a custodial model, differing from Tony's non-custodial approach.
- Tony's construction allows BTC and USD channels integration within the same LN node, enhancing functionality.
- Emphasizing distinct features of each model is essential for accurate discussions in the LN ecosystem.
